incidents.name: Cloudflare WAF Zone Lockdown Impacted

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating, an issue which potentially impacts customers using the Zone Lockdown feature.

incidents.name: Durable Objects Failing To Wake From Hibernation

incident_updates.body: Issues with Durable Object hibernation have been resolved after completion of the rollback. Customers with affected Durable Objects do not need to take any action: impacted Objects have restarted and recovered automatically.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: We are reverting a change that coincides with this issue. The rollback is currently in progress.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body:
Some Durable Objects using the WebSocket Hibernation API are failing to call WebSocket::send() after waking from hibernation, which is preventing WebSocket messages from being delivered to clients.
we are now rolling out a fix.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: We are investigating reports of Durable Objects having issues waking from Websocket hibernation.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

components.name: Durable Objects
components.description: Durable Objects provide low-latency coordination and consistent permanent storage for the Workers platform.

incidents.name: Elevated errors observed for WARP users.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
WARP users may observe elevated error rates, degraded performance, or an overall degraded experience.

incidents.name: SOC alerting for Core Applications was impacted

incident_updates.body: On July 3, 2025, between 15:43 UTC and 20:10 UTC, customers may have experienced an impact to Cloudflare Core applications SOC alerting. This was due to an error encountered after a configuration update. The issue has been rectified, and all alerting is now functioning as expected with no ongoing impact.

incidents.name: China Network connectivity problems

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are seeing reduced impact after implementing mitigations in some locations and are continuing to look into remaining issues.

Cloudflare is investigating potential connectivity issues related to unexpected DNS resolution for a subset of customers using China Network from some locations in China.

We are assessing impact and causes and will provide further updates as soon as possible.

incidents.name: R2 Elevated error rates in ENAM region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Customers with buckets in the Eastern North American region may see elevated error rates on GetObject operations to R2.

components.name: R2
components.description: High-performance storage for files and objects with zero egress charges

incidents.name: R2 elevated errors during CompleteMultipart operations

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've deployed a fix for the multipart uploads that were failing on Complete Multipart calls, and error rates have returned to normal levels. We will continue monitoring impact.
We've isolated the pattern leading to Multipart Uploads that are erroring during CompleteMultipartUploads and are preparing a fix for those requests.

Cloudflare has observed an increase in HTTP 500 responses on some CompleteMultipart API requests containing parts uploaded between 21:03 and 21:26 UTC.  We are working to analyze and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

components.name: R2
components.description: High-performance storage for files and objects with zero egress charges

incidents.name: A subset of Durable Object Container applications were unable to start

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Cloudflare is investigating a subset of Durable Object Container applications that were unable to start in Eastern and Western Europe from 18:05 - 19:57 UTC. There is no further impact at this time.

incidents.name: Elevated errors and latency for R2 in ENAM

incident_updates.body: Customers leveraging R2 in the Eastern North American region may have experienced increased latency and/or error rates between 16:30 and 17:20 30/6/2025 UTC.

incidents.name: Missing "Additional Logs" for OWASP managed rules WAF events

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating issues where customers may experience missing additional information in logs in Security Events. This specifically impacts certain requests that trigger the OWASP Core Managed Ruleset.

incidents.name: High R2 request latency in ENAM region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
R2 users with buckets in the ENAM region may be experiencing elevated request latency and lower bandwidth throughput on get and put requests to R2.

incidents.name: Stream Playback Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The team has identified a contributing issue between caching and storage retrieval. An improvement has been released and is being monitored. Additionally, we have adjusted player retry logic to reduce potential stalling. We are continuing our investigation.
The team has identified a contributing issue between caching and storage retrieval. A fix has been released and we will be monitoring for improvements while continuing our investigation.
We are currently investigating reports of intermittent errors impacting Stream on-demand video playback.

components.name: Stream
components.description: Cloudflare Stream lets you or your end users upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API, without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

incidents.name: Cloudflare Access experiencing elevated login failures from OneLogin

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.
Cloudflare Engineering has confirmed the login failures are coming from OneLogin. The OneLogin team has been notified and is investigating.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Access when logging in with OneLogin.

All other identity providers and Access services are working as expected.

components.name: Access
components.description: Cloudflare Access determines who can reach your application by applying the Access policies you configure

incidents.name: Issues with Cloudflare Workers Creation

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating an issue with the manual creation of Cloudflare Workers from existing repositories for some users. Guided creation is not impacted.

Existing workers are not affected. We will provide more information shortly.

components.name: Workers
components.description: Cloudflare Workers provides a serverless execution environment that allows you to create new applications or augment existing ones without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

Cloudflare was investigating network performance issues in Brussels.

The impact started at 11:48 UTC and ended at 12:18 UTC.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Zero Trust

Cloudflare has identified issues with the Gateway HTTP policies. Customer is unable to save a HTTP policy when using Application selector and selecting full application categories.

We are working on a fix to resolve this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

components.name: Gateway
components.description: Cloudflare’s secure web gateway keeps your data safe from malware, ransomware, phishing, command & control, Shadow IT, and other Internet risks over all ports and protocols. Log every user interaction with rich details.

incidents.name: Elevated Durable Objects Timeouts

incident_updates.body: A code release rolling out across Cloudflare's network increased frequency of Durable Objects timeouts between approximately 2025-06-20 23:45 UTC to 2025-06-21 05:30 UTC. The code release was reverted and investigation is ongoing for the root cause. Products such as R2 and Queues which rely on Durable Objects were impacted.

incidents.name: Auto SSL/TLS configuration endpoints returning errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with auto SSL/TLS configuration endpoints returning errors.

These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.

Customers using the Dashboard / Cloudflare APIs are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.

components.name: API
components.description: Application programming interface (API) for customers to read and write their configurations at https://api.cloudflare.com

components.name: Dashboard
components.description: Dashboard where customers can view and make changes to their configurations at https://dash.cloudflare.com

incidents.name: Cloudflare Blog Issues

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.
We have identified and implemented a fix for this issue and are currently monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is aware of and investigating and issue when visiting the Cloudflare Blog. Visitors might encounter 5xx errors when visiting the site.

We will provide further updates shortly.

incidents.name: proxy_read_timeout endpoint and maximum upload size return 400 error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare has identified an issue where our proxy_read_timeout endpoint and maximum upload size return 400 error. We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

components.name: API
components.description: Application programming interface (API) for customers to read and write their configurations at https://api.cloudflare.com

incidents.name: Access for SaaS applications failing to authenticate

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Cloudflare engineering is working on reverting the affected signing keys. We do not advise updating keys if you are impacted.

Cloudflare engineering is investigating an issue causing authentication to fail for some Access for SaaS applications. This is due to an incorrect certificate signing key. The engineering team is investigating a solution to revert to the original keys. 

Access self-hosted and private network application authentication is not impacted at this time.

components.name: Access
components.description: Cloudflare Access determines who can reach your application by applying the Access policies you configure

Cloudflare has identified an issue where some customers may experience issues setting Browser Cache TTL. We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: RealtimeKit dashboard unavailable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Login to the RealtimeKit control plane unavailable. Team is investigating. Existing meetings and RealtimeKit apps unaffected.

components.name: RealtimeKit
components.description:
Build real-time serverless video, audio and data applications.

Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

We're currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Snippets Preview Unavailable in Dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating an issue affecting the Snippets dashboard preview. When attempting to view or edit a Snippet, users may encounter error messages in the UI.

This issue is isolated to the dashboard preview and does not impact existing Snippets functionality at the edge or the ability to deploy new Snippets rules or code. Snippets continue to run normally for end users.

We are working to resolve the dashboard error and restore preview functionality as quickly as possible.

components.name: Snippets
components.description: Cloudflare Snippets provide a flexible way to customize the behavior of your website or application using short pieces of JavaScript code. Use snippets to customize HTTP response headers, implement JWT validation, define complex redirect functionality, and more.

incidents.name: Broad Cloudflare service outages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Cloudflare Sites and Services - Waiting Room
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Workers AI

incident_updates.body: All Cloudflare services have been restored and are now fully operational. We are moving the incident to Monitoring while we watch platform metrics to confirm sustained stability.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Realtime SFU
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Realtime TURN Service
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Waiting Room
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Workers AI
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Workers KV

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare services are recovering quickly around the globe. WARP and Turnstile are operational, though a small residual impact remains and we’re working to eliminate it. The core KV service is restored, bringing dependent products back online. We expect further recovery over the next few minutes and a steady drop in impact.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Realtime SFU
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Realtime TURN Service
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Waiting Room
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Workers AI
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Workers KV

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare’s critical Workers KV service went offline due to an outage of a 3rd party service that is a key dependency. As a result, certain Cloudflare products that rely on KV service to store and disseminate information are unavailable including:

Access
WARP
Browser Isolation
Browser Rendering
Durable Objects (SQLite backed Durable Objects only)
Workers KV
Realtime
Workers AI
Stream
Parts of the Cloudflare dashboard
Turnstile
AI Gateway
AutoRAG

Cloudflare engineers are working to restore services immediately. We are aware of the deep impact this outage has caused and are working with all hands on deck to restore all services as quickly as possible.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Realtime SFU
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Realtime TURN Service
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Waiting Room
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Workers AI
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Workers KV

incident_updates.body: We are starting to see services recover. We still expect to see intermittent errors across the impacted services as systems handle retried and caches are filled.

components.name: Access
components.description: Cloudflare Access determines who can reach your application by applying the Access policies you configure

components.name: Dashboard
components.description: Dashboard where customers can view and make changes to their configurations at https://dash.cloudflare.com

components.name: Durable Objects
components.description: Durable Objects provide low-latency coordination and consistent permanent storage for the Workers platform.

components.name: Realtime SFU
components.description: Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

components.name: Realtime TURN Service
components.description:
Separately from the SFU, Realtime offers a managed TURN service. TURN acts as a relay point for traffic between WebRTC clients like the browser and SFUs, particularly in scenarios where direct communication is obstructed by NATs or firewalls. TURN maintains an allocation of public IP addresses and ports for each session, ensuring connectivity even in restrictive network environments.

Using Cloudflare Realtime TURN service is available free of charge when used together with the Realtime SFU. Otherwise, it costs $0.05/real-time GB outbound from Cloudflare to the TURN client.

components.name: RealtimeKit
components.description:
Build real-time serverless video, audio and data applications.

Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

components.name: Stream
components.description: Cloudflare Stream lets you or your end users upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API, without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

components.name: Waiting Room
components.description: Cloudflare Waiting Room protects websites by queueing site visitors when a website experiences unmanageable surges in legitimate traffic that may otherwise bring an application down.

components.name: Workers AI
components.description: Workers AI allows you to run machine learning models, on the Cloudflare network, from your own code – whether that be from Workers, Pages, or anywhere via REST API.

components.name: Workers KV
components.description: Workers KV is a data storage that allows you to store and retrieve data globally to build dynamic and performant APIs and websites that support high read volumes with low latency

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating an issue with Durable Objects which potentially impacts multiple customers in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region. incidents.name: WARP connectivity

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified that the issue is restricted to our YVR colo (Vancouver, BC, Canada), and currently working on mitigation.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare WARP and Cloudflare Zero Trust. Cloudflare WARP and Zero Trust users may experience connectivity issues or a degraded Internet experience.

incidents.name: Recurring Spikes of HTTP 520 Errors and Latency in Columbus

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare customers may have observed spikes of elevated 520 error response rates and increased latency from our Columbus, Ohio (CMH) facility periodically between 2025-04-04 and 2025-05-11.

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare was aware of and investigated increased connection timeouts for Zero Trust Gateway and WARP in Luxembourg (LUX).

This issue started at 12:22 UTC and has been resolved at 15:42 UTC.
